ground_truth: Mike sighs, deciding to level with her, and just then, the waitress walks up. He stands up, and Abby looks out at the dance floor, seeing that even the worst dancers are great. Mike grabs her hand and leads her onto the dance floor, and they make their way onto the crowded dance floor. They give a longer kiss, and Mike starts out of the elevator, then returns, grabbing Abby, and suddenly, they're all over each other. In the midst of this, the elevators try to close, but their furious groping blocks it, until a shrill buzzing begins. They abruptly step apart, staring at each other, and Mike backs out of the elevator, looking shell-shocked as the doors close. Abby is flushed and stunned, then sinks down onto her bed, wearing the same expression. She leaps up, smooths her hair, checks her reflection, and goes to the door, opening it with a smile to find Colin standing there, bottle of red wine in hand. He walks in the room, holding up the wine, while Mike approaches Abby's door. Mike reels, trying to cover his shock as Abby appears behind Colin. He turns and goes, with Mike walking down the hall, freaked out and perturbed, as Abby runs to catch up with him. He keeps walking as she tries to keep up, then stops and looks at her. They hold eye contact for a very long moment before Mike looks away, shrugs, and walks off. Abby enters the room where Colin stands shirtless, and she takes the glass and drinks, and keeps drinking. Abby finishes the glass and looks at him, smiles, pleased, then he continues, but her smile fades. Abby looks at him, nodding, then she looks around, feeling hurt and stunned, but overcomes it with fierce and abiding hatred. Abby and Joy walk through the waiting area, which is filled with Mike Alexander replacement hopefuls of all different shapes and sizes, and Abby points at candidates while Joy makes notes on a clipboard, looking a little worried. Stuart sits in the control room next to Cliff as Jack Magnum does his intro, now standing in a balloon basket. Mike looks over to see live footage from the Balloon Fiesta on TV as Jack Magnum continues to alienate his audience. Jack Magnum is tackled and pushed out of the balloon basket, and after a moment, a frazzled Abby pops up in his place. Stuart and Cliff watch from the control room in shock, and Stuart picks up, then blanches. Abby stands in the basket, still nervous but flying on adrenaline, and Mike stares at Abby on TV for a second, then grabs his keys and races out as Jonah calls after him.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Mike sighs and decides to be honest with her just as the waitress arrives. He stands, and Abby notices even the worst dancers are impressive. Mike takes her hand, leading her onto the crowded dance floor. They share a long kiss, and as Mike exits the elevator, he returns to grab Abby, and they passionately embrace. The elevator tries to close, but their intense embrace blocks it until a buzzing sound starts. They separate, staring at each other, and Mike exits, looking shocked as the doors close. Abby, flushed and stunned, sits on her bed, then jumps up, fixes her hair, checks her reflection, and opens the door to find Colin with a bottle of red wine. He enters, holding the wine, while Mike approaches Abby's door. Mike tries to hide his shock as Abby appears behind Colin. Mike leaves, disturbed, as Abby runs after him. He stops, they lock eyes, then he looks away and walks off. Abby returns to Colin, drinks a glass of wine, smiles, but her smile fades. She feels hurt but overcomes it with intense hatred. Abby and Joy walk through a waiting area filled with Mike Alexander replacement hopefuls, and Abby points at candidates while Joy takes notes, looking worried. Stuart sits in the control room with Cliff as Jack Magnum does his intro from a balloon basket. Mike sees live footage from the Balloon Fiesta on TV as Jack alienates his audience. Jack is tackled and pushed out of the basket, and a frazzled Abby appears in his place. Stuart and Cliff watch in shock, and Stuart blanches. Abby stands in the basket, nervous but fueled by adrenaline, and Mike stares at her on TV, then grabs his keys and races out as Jonah calls after him.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Mike sighs, deciding to be honest with her, as the waitress arrives. He stands, and Abby notices even the worst dancers are great. Mike leads her onto the crowded dance floor. They kiss, and Mike exits the elevator, then returns, grabbing Abby. They're all over each other, blocking the elevator until a buzzing starts. They separate, staring at each other, and Mike backs out, shell-shocked as the doors close. Abby, flushed and stunned, sits on her bed, then checks her reflection and opens the door to Colin with wine. He enters, holding the wine, as Mike approaches Abby's door, shocked to see her with Colin. Mike leaves, perturbed, as Abby runs after him. They hold eye contact before Mike walks off. Abby returns to Colin, drinks, smiles, but her smile fades. Abby feels hurt but overcomes it with hatred. Abby and Joy walk through a waiting area filled with Mike Alexander hopefuls, and Abby points at candidates while Joy takes notes, worried. Stuart and Cliff watch Jack Magnum's intro from the control room. Mike sees live footage from the Balloon Fiesta as Jack alienates his audience. Jack is tackled out of the balloon basket, and Abby appears in his place. Stuart and Cliff are shocked, and Stuart blanches. Abby stands in the basket, nervous but fueled by adrenaline, and Mike stares at her on TV, then grabs his keys and races out as Jonah calls after him.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Mike lets out a deep sigh, deciding that it's time to be honest with her, and just at that moment, the waitress approaches their table. He rises to his feet, and Abby turns her gaze toward the dance floor, noticing that even those who are not the best dancers seem to be having a great time. Mike takes her hand gently and guides her onto the bustling dance floor, and together they make their way into the throng of dancers. They share a lingering kiss, and as Mike begins to exit the elevator, he suddenly returns, pulling Abby back to him, and in an instant, they are passionately entangled. Amidst their fervent embrace, the elevator doors attempt to close, but their intense groping prevents it, until a loud, shrill buzzing noise starts. They quickly separate, staring at each other in surprise, and Mike steps out of the elevator, looking utterly shocked as the doors finally close. Abby, feeling flushed and bewildered, sinks down onto her bed, wearing the same stunned expression. She quickly jumps up, smooths her hair, checks her reflection in the mirror, and heads to the door, opening it with a smile to find Colin standing there, holding a bottle of red wine. He enters the room, raising the wine bottle in greeting, while Mike approaches Abby's door. Mike is reeling, trying to mask his shock as Abby appears behind Colin. He turns and leaves, with Mike walking down the hallway, feeling freaked out and perturbed, as Abby rushes to catch up with him. He continues walking as she tries to keep pace, then he stops and looks at her intently. They maintain eye contact for a prolonged moment before Mike looks away, gives a slight shrug, and walks off. Abby enters the room where Colin stands shirtless, and she takes the glass he offers, drinking deeply and continuously. Abby finishes the glass, looks at him with a pleased smile, but as he continues, her smile fades. Abby looks at him, nodding, then glances around, feeling hurt and stunned, but she overcomes it with a fierce and abiding hatred. Abby and Joy walk through the waiting area, which is filled with hopeful candidates of all different shapes and sizes, each vying to be Mike Alexander's replacement, and Abby points at various candidates while Joy makes notes on a clipboard, looking slightly worried. Stuart sits in the control room next to Cliff as Jack Magnum begins his introduction, now standing in a balloon basket. Mike glances over to see live footage from the Balloon Fiesta being broadcast on TV as Jack Magnum continues to alienate his audience. Jack Magnum is tackled and pushed out of the balloon basket, and after a brief moment, a frazzled Abby pops up in his place. Stuart and Cliff watch from the control room in shock, and Stuart picks up the phone, then blanches. Abby stands in the basket, still nervous but fueled by adrenaline, and Mike stares at Abby on the TV screen for a moment, then grabs his keys and races out as Jonah calls after him.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Mike lets out a profound and heavy sigh, coming to the conclusion that the moment has arrived for him to be truthful and completely open with her. However, right at that precise instant, the waitress approaches their table with a friendly demeanor. Rising to his feet, Mike catches Abby's attention as she shifts her gaze toward the lively dance floor. She observes that even those individuals who are typically not the most skilled dancers seem to be genuinely enjoying themselves. Mike gently takes Abby's hand, leading her with care onto the crowded dance floor where they gracefully make their way into the midst of the dancing crowd. They share a lingering and heartfelt kiss, and as Mike begins to exit the elevator, he suddenly has a change of heart and returns, pulling Abby back into his arms. In an instant, they are passionately wrapped up in each other's embrace. Amidst their fervent entanglement, the elevator doors attempt to close, but their intense and enthusiastic groping keeps it from shutting entirely until a loud, shrill buzzing noise disrupts them. Startled, they quickly separate and stare at each other in surprise and bewilderment. Mike steps out of the elevator, looking utterly shocked as the doors finally close behind him. Abby, feeling flushed and bewildered, collapses down onto her bed, wearing the same stunned expression as before. She swiftly jumps up, smooths her hair with quick movements, checks her reflection in the mirror, and heads to the door. Opening it with a welcoming smile, she finds Colin standing there, holding a bottle of rich red wine. He enters the room, raising the wine bottle in a friendly greeting, while Mike approaches Abby's door, still reeling from the recent events and trying to mask his shock and confusion as Abby appears behind Colin. Mike turns and walks away, with a flustered Abby rushing to catch up with him. Mike continues walking as Abby tries desperately to keep pace with him; then, he abruptly stops and looks at her with an intense gaze. They maintain eye contact for a prolonged moment filled with unspoken words before Mike looks away, gives a slight shrug of resignation, and walks off. Abby enters the room where Colin stands shirtless, and she takes the glass of wine he offers, drinking deeply and continuously. After finishing the glass, Abby looks at him with a pleased smile, but as he continues speaking, her smile fades away. Abby nods at him, then glances around her surroundings, feeling hurt and stunned, but soon she overcomes it with a fierce and abiding hatred. Abby and Joy walk through the waiting area, which is filled with hopeful candidates of various different shapes and sizes, each one eagerly vying to be Mike Alexander's replacement. Abby points at various candidates while Joy diligently makes notes on a clipboard, looking slightly worried about the situation. Meanwhile, Stuart sits in the control room beside Cliff as Jack Magnum begins his introduction, now standing confidently in a balloon basket. Mike glances over to see live footage from the Balloon Fiesta being broadcast on TV as Jack Magnum continues to alienate his audience. Suddenly, Jack Magnum is tackled and pushed out of the balloon basket, and after a brief moment of chaos, a frazzled and nervous Abby pops up in his place. In the control room, Stuart and Cliff watch the unfolding events in shock, and Stuart picks up the phone, only to blanch at the situation. Standing in the basket, Abby is still nervous but fueled by the rush of adrenaline. Meanwhile, Mike stares at the TV screen, watching Abby for a moment before grabbing his keys and racing out as Jonah calls after him, trying to catch his attention.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Mike lets out a deep sigh, feeling the weight of the moment, and makes the decision to be honest with her. Just as he is about to speak, the waitress approaches their table, interrupting the moment. He rises from his seat, and Abby's gaze drifts towards the dance floor, where she observes that even those with the least skill are dancing with enthusiasm and joy. Mike gently takes her hand, guiding her with a firm yet gentle pull towards the dance floor, weaving through the throng of people until they find a spot amidst the crowd. They share a lingering kiss, savoring the connection, before Mike steps out of the elevator. However, he quickly returns, pulling Abby back into his arms, and they become completely engrossed in each other. As they passionately embrace, the elevator doors attempt to close, but their fervent movements prevent it, causing a loud buzzing sound to fill the space. Startled by the noise, they abruptly separate, their eyes locking in a moment of shared surprise and intensity. Mike slowly backs out of the elevator, his expression one of shock and disbelief, as the doors slide shut. Abby, left alone, feels a rush of emotions, her face flushed and her mind reeling. She collapses onto her bed, still wearing the same stunned expression, before springing up with renewed energy. She quickly smooths her hair, checks her reflection in the mirror, and heads to the door, opening it with a bright smile to find Colin standing there, holding a bottle of red wine. He steps into the room, presenting the wine with a gesture of offering, while simultaneously, Mike approaches Abby's door, his mind racing as he tries to mask his surprise. Abby appears behind Colin, and Mike, feeling a mix of emotions, turns away and walks down the hall, his mind in turmoil. Abby, sensing the tension, rushes to catch up with him, her footsteps quickening as she tries to match his pace. He continues walking, seemingly lost in thought, until he finally stops and turns to face her. They lock eyes, holding each other's gaze for an extended moment, filled with unspoken words and emotions, before Mike breaks the connection, looks away with a shrug, and continues on his way. Abby returns to the room where Colin stands, now shirtless, and she accepts the glass he offers, taking a sip and then another, drinking deeply. As she finishes the glass, she looks at him with a smile of satisfaction, but as he continues speaking, her smile fades, replaced by a look of realization and disappointment. Abby nods in response to his words, her eyes scanning the room as she processes her feelings, a mix of hurt and shock giving way to a fierce and abiding sense of anger. Later, Abby and Joy walk through the waiting area, which is bustling with hopeful candidates of all shapes and sizes vying to replace Mike Alexander. Abby points out potential candidates while Joy diligently makes notes on a clipboard, her expression tinged with concern. Meanwhile, in the control room, Stuart sits next to Cliff as Jack Magnum begins his introduction, now standing in a balloon basket. Mike's attention is drawn to the live footage from the Balloon Fiesta playing on the TV, where Jack Magnum's antics continue to alienate the audience. Suddenly, Jack is tackled and pushed out of the balloon basket, and after a brief pause, a frazzled Abby emerges in his place, her nerves evident but adrenaline propelling her forward. Stuart and Cliff watch the scene unfold from the control room, their faces a mix of shock and disbelief, as Stuart picks up the phone, his expression turning pale. Abby stands in the basket, her initial nervousness giving way to a surge of adrenaline, while Mike, watching her on TV, is momentarily transfixed. Without hesitation, he grabs his keys and rushes out, ignoring Jonah's calls as he races to be where Abby is.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Mike decides to be honest with Abby just as the waitress arrives. He stands, and Abby observes the dance floor, noting the impressive dancers. Mike takes her hand, leading her onto the crowded dance floor, where they share a longer kiss. As they exit the elevator, they become engrossed in each other, blocking the doors until a buzzing sound interrupts them. They separate, and Mike, looking shocked, exits as the doors close. Abby, equally stunned, sits on her bed before quickly preparing herself to greet Colin, who arrives with wine. As Colin enters, Mike approaches Abby's door, shocked to see her with Colin. Mike leaves, visibly disturbed, with Abby chasing after him. They share a long look before Mike walks away. Abby returns to Colin, drinks a glass of wine, initially pleased but then disillusioned. She feels hurt but channels it into determination. Later, Abby and Joy evaluate candidates to replace Mike, with Joy taking notes. Meanwhile, Stuart and Cliff watch Jack Magnum's intro from the control room, where he alienates his audience at the Balloon Fiesta. Jack is tackled out of the balloon basket, and Abby appears in his place, nervous but energized. Stuart and Cliff are shocked, and Mike, seeing Abby on TV, grabs his keys and rushes out as Jonah calls after him.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Mike sighs, deciding to level with her, revealing a sincere side that he's rarely shown, and just then, the waitress, a local favorite known for her quick service at the bustling downtown diner, walks up. He stands up, and Abby looks out at the dance floor, seeing that even the worst dancers, just like in the renowned dance clubs of New York City, are great. Mike grabs her hand and leads her onto the dance floor, a space packed with couples moving to the rhythm of a popular local band, and they make their way onto the crowded dance floor. They give a longer kiss, and Mike starts out of the elevator, then returns, grabbing Abby, and suddenly, they're all over each other. In the midst of this, the elevators, in a fashionable hotel known for hosting glamorous events, try to close, but their furious groping blocks it, until a shrill buzzing begins. They abruptly step apart, staring at each other, and Mike backs out of the elevator, looking shell-shocked as the doors, crafted from polished steel, close. Abby is flushed and stunned, then sinks down onto her bed, wearing the same expression. She leaps up, smooths her hair styled in a way she learned from a well-known stylist's tutorial, checks her reflection, and goes to the door, opening it with a smile to find Colin standing there, bottle of red wine, a vintage from a distinguished Napa Valley vineyard, in hand. He walks in the room, holding up the wine, while Mike approaches Abby's door. Mike reels, trying to cover his shock as Abby appears behind Colin. He turns and goes, with Mike walking down the hall, designed with art deco influences, freaked out and perturbed, as Abby runs to catch up with him. He keeps walking as she tries to keep up, then stops and looks at her. They hold eye contact for a very long moment before Mike looks away, shrugs, and walks off. Abby enters the room where Colin stands shirtless, exuding confidence gained from years of successful business ventures, and she takes the glass and drinks, and keeps drinking. Abby finishes the glass and looks at him, smiles, pleased, then he continues, but her smile fades, recalling a painful memory from their past. Abby looks at him, nodding, then she looks around, feeling hurt and stunned, but overcomes it with fierce and abiding hatred, a response rooted in earlier betrayals. Abby and Joy walk through the waiting area, a space bustling with anticipation, which is filled with Mike Alexander replacement hopefuls of all different shapes and sizes, and Abby points at candidates while Joy, a meticulous planner known for her organization skills, makes notes on a clipboard, looking a little worried. Stuart, a seasoned producer with a talent for live broadcasts, sits in the control room next to Cliff as Jack Magnum does his intro, now standing in a balloon basket, an unexpected twist at the annual Balloon Fiesta in Albuquerque. Mike looks over to see live footage from the Balloon Fiesta on TV as Jack Magnum continues to alienate his audience with his brash commentary. Jack Magnum is tackled and pushed out of the balloon basket, and after a moment, a frazzled Abby pops up in his place, an impulsive move reminiscent of her college days in improvisational theater. Stuart and Cliff watch from the control room in shock, and Stuart picks up, then blanches at the network's reaction. Abby stands in the basket, still nervous but flying on adrenaline, reminiscent of her fearless younger self, and Mike stares at Abby on TV for a second, then grabs his keys and races out, driven by a sense of urgency and lingering affection, as Jonah, a loyal friend and colleague, calls after him.

Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. He keeps walking as she tries to keep up then stops and looks at her. They hold eye contact for a very long moment before Mike looks away shrugs and walks off. Abby enters the room where Colin stands shirtless and she takes the glass and drinks and keeps drinking. Abby finishes the glass and looks at him smiles pleased then he continues but her smile fades. Abby looks at him nodding then she looks around feeling hurt and stunned but overcomes it with fierce and abiding hatred. Abby and Joy walk through the waiting area which is filled with Mike Alexander replacement hopefuls of all different shapes and sizes and Abby points at candidates while Joy makes notes on a clipboard looking a little worried. Stuart sits in the control room next to Cliff as Jack Magnum does his intro now standing in a balloon basket. Mike looks over to see live footage from the Balloon Fiesta on TV as Jack Magnum continues to alienate his audience. Jack Magnum is tackled and pushed out of the balloon basket and after a moment a frazzled Abby pops up in his place. Stuart and Cliff watch from the control room in shock and Stuart picks up then blanches. Abby stands in the basket still nervous but flying on adrenaline and Mike stares at Abby on TV for a second then grabs his keys and races out as Jonah calls after him.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Mike sighs deciding to level with her and just then the waitress walks up. He stands up and Abby looks out at the dance floor seeing that even the worst dancers are great. Mike grabs her hand and leads her onto the dance floor and they make their way onto the crowded dance floor. They give a longer kiss and Mike starts out of the elevator then returns grabbing Abby and suddenly they are all over each other. In the midst of this the elevators try to close but their furious groping blocks it until a shrill buzzing begins. They abruptly step apart staring at each other and Mike backs out of the elevator looking shellshocked as the doors close. Stuart sits in the control room next to Cliff as Jack Magnum does his intro now standing in a balloon basket. Mike looks over to see live footage from the Balloon Fiesta on TV as Jack Magnum continues to alienate his audience. Jack Magnum is tackled and pushed out of the balloon basket and after a moment a frazzled Abby pops up in his place. Stuart and Cliff watch from the control room in shock and Stuart picks up then blanches. Abby stands in the basket still nervous but flying on adrenaline and Mike stares at Abby on TV for a second then grabs his keys and races out as Jonah calls after him.

Mike grabs her hand and leads her onto the dance floor and they make their way onto the crowded dance floor. Stuart and Cliff watch from the control room in shock and Stuart picks up then blanches. Abby stands in the basket still nervous but flying on adrenaline and Mike stares at Abby on TV for a second then grabs his keys and races out as Jonah calls after him.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Jake coughs, attempting to dance with her, and just then, the librarian strolls over. He jumps up, and Carla peers at the swimming pool, realizing that even the clumsiest swimmers are amazing. Jake taps her shoulder and guides her toward the swimming pool, and they glide their way into the crowded swimming pool. They share a longer nap, and Jake steps out of the helicopter, then returns, pulling Carla, and suddenly, they're tangled in each other. During all this, the helicopters try to hover, but their frantic paddling jams it, until a loud honking begins. They quickly separate, glaring at each other, and Jake strolls out of the helicopter, looking bewildered as the doors swing shut. Carla is blushing and astonished, then collapses onto her couch, displaying the same look. She hops up, fixes her dress, checks her appearance, and heads to the window, sliding it open with a grin to find Harry standing there, loaf of rye bread in hand. He steps into the room, raising the bread, while Jake nears Carla's window. Jake spins, trying to mask his astonishment as Carla emerges beside Harry. He pivots and leaves, with Jake walking down the corridor, flustered and annoyed, as Carla dashes to catch up with him. He continues moving as she struggles to keep pace, then pauses and gazes at her. They maintain eye contact for a prolonged instant before Jake glances away, shrugs, and storms off. Carla enters the lounge where Harry stands barefoot, and she picks up the mug and sips, and keeps sipping. Carla empties the mug and glances at him, grins, delighted, then he persists, but her grin diminishes. Carla glances at him, agreeing, then she scans the room, feeling upset and dazed, but conquers it with intense and enduring animosity. Carla and Lucy stride through the lounge area, which is crowded with Jake Oliver substitute aspirants of all distinct forms and dimensions, and Carla gestures at volunteers while Lucy scribbles on a clipboard, appearing slightly anxious. Robert sits in the recording booth next to Mark as Billy Steele delivers his intro, now sitting in a canoe. Jake glances over to witness live broadcast from the Canoe Festival on TV as Billy Steele proceeds to distance his viewers. Billy Steele is shoved and flipped out of the canoe, and after a few moments, an agitated Carla pops up in his spot. Robert and Mark observe from the recording booth in disbelief, and Robert reaches up, then turns pale. Carla stands in the canoe, still anxious but energized by excitement, and Jake gawks at Carla on TV for a moment, then snatches his wallet and dashes out as Ivan shouts after him.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Mike decides to be honest with Abby as the waitress arrives, leading them onto the dance floor. They kiss passionately in the elevator until the doors try to close. Stunned, Mike exits, leaving a flustered Abby who later greets Colin with wine. As Mike approaches Abby's door, he sees her with Colin, masking his shock as Abby tries to follow him. They share a tense moment before Mike walks away. Abby returns to Colin, feeling hurt but eventually transforms her emotions into intense hatred. Abby and Joy assess Mike's replacements while Stuart and Cliff monitor Jack Magnum's disastrous Balloon Fiesta segment. Jack is pushed from the basket, and Abby appears in his place, nervous but exhilarated. Mike, watching on TV, dashes out as Jonah calls after him.
